definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Production increased steadily. The growth rate was somewhat lower than that of last year.
sentences.chinese: 生產穩定增長，增速比上年有所回落。

sentences.english: Wired telephone lines to 121,769, an increase from the year earlier.
sentences.chinese: 有線電話線路爲121，769門，較上年有所增加。

sentences.english: Last Arbor Day I planted two trees.
sentences.chinese: 上年的植樹節，我種了兩棵樹。

sentences.english: The number of filings was 14% above year-ago levels.
sentences.chinese: 破產申請數量較上年同期水平增長14%。

sentences.english: On the map that promontory looks like a nose, naughtily turned up.
sentences.chinese: 從地圖上年，那個海角就像一隻調皮地翹起來的鼻子。

sentences.english: Huawei said that shipments for the mid-to-high-end category recorded a year-on-year increase of 70%.
sentences.chinese: 華爲稱其行銷海外的中高端機型比上年增長70%。

sentences.english: last summer the drummer became an amateur dramatist dramatically.
sentences.chinese: 上年炎天，鼓手戲劇性地變成了業餘劇作家。

sentences.english: The central government allocated . billion yuan in special employment funds, an increase of 59%.
sentences.chinese: 中央財政安置就業專項資金億元，比上年增長59%。

sentences.english: When I reached college, I realized that I had accumulated a year's worth of credits.
sentences.chinese: 上年夜學後，本人認識到本身曾經累計了一年的學分。

sentences.english: The state of severe flood is easily influenced by the drought and flood type of the previous year.
sentences.chinese: 嚴重雨澇類型受上年旱澇類型影響較大。

sentences.english: I went swimming with my family in the sea last summer.
sentences.chinese: 上年炎天我以及我家人去了海里游泳。

definition: (literary) every year/year after year/in recent years/Taiwan pr. [bi4 nian2]
late last year/the end of last year
to compare/to dispute/compared to/(before adj.) relatively/comparatively/rather/also pr. [jiao3]
